meanings.definition: The unit of force in the International System of Units, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one meter per second per second on a mass of one kilogram.
meanings.sent1: He measured the weight of the object in newtons using a special scale.
meanings.sent2: The apple fell to the ground due to the pull of gravity in newtons.
meanings.sent3: The newtons on the scale seemed to be playing a game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: Her determination exerted a force on her goals like newtons on an object.
meanings.sent5: The newtons of the storm winds made the trees sway violently.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the surname Newton.
meanings.sent1: The Newtons were a prominent family in the town's history.
meanings.sent2: I met the Newtons at the community event last week.
meanings.sent3: The Newtons always hosted the best neighborhood barbecues.
meanings.sent4: The Newtons' house stood out with its bright red door.
meanings.sent5: The Newtons' dog barked loudly whenever someone passed by.
